byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MAYY EL SHEIKH

abstract: Veteran leaders of Muslim Brotherhood call for peace, alarmed by demands from organization's younger members for violent retribution against Egyptian government; security forces have killed over 1,000 Brotherhood supporters, detained thousands and seized group assets since Pres Abdel Fatah el-Sisi labeled them murderous regime and made them target of eradication target.
lead_paragraph: The group faces a widening generational split at a time when its discipline is fraying and many young members blame their elders for bungling the Arab Spring revolt.

headline.main: Push for Retribution in Egypt Frays Muslim Brotherhood
headline.print_headline: Push for Retribution in Egypt Frays Muslim Brotherhood

snippet: The group faces a widening generational split at a time when its discipline is fraying and many young members blame their elders for bungling the Arab Spring revolt.
